answers.answer: When a test is inconclusive, it usually means that there are multiple results that conflict with eachother.  Given your family history, I encourage you to bring the results to a diabetes specialist (preferably an endocrinologist), or ask the physician who prescribed the tests for a full explanation.

question: I am 40 years old with a family history of diabetes; mother, aunt, 2 uncles. I was given a diabetes blood test. Dr said it came back inconclusive. I was wondering, what can cause an inconclusive diabetes test.
title: inconclusive diabetes test
